author: bridge-bot
content: <ch4r10t33r> A quick follow-up from todayâ€™s call: which parameters differ between XMSS of leanSig and leanMultisig? Is it only the encoding scheme, or do any of the hypercube parameters change as well? Iâ€™m asking so I can apply the corresponding updates in hash-zig. @Benewagner @tcoratger

author: bridge-bot
content: <Benewagner> As far as I know, leanMultisig does not use tweaks, a different encoding, and maybe other sizes of hashes. Also potentially other hypercube parameters

author: bridge-bot
content: <Benewagner> In the long run, we want to use the provably secure version (ie leanSig) potentially with another encoding so that leanVM can aggregate it

author: bridge-bot
content:
<DivyaRanjan1905> re: **@ch4r10t33r**
> A quick follow-up from todayâ€™s call: which parameters differ between XMSS of leanSig and leanMultisig? Is it only the encoding scheme, or do any of the hypercube parameters change as well? Iâ€™m asking so I can apply the corresponding updates in hash-zig. @Benewagner @tcoratger
From what I understand, mostly the encoding scheme and the aggregation part differ. leanMultisig also doesn't use tweaks. The core XMSS parameters are more or less similar. Verification in leanMultisig happens inside a proof.
